informal_statement: Prove that no three consecutive coefficients of the power series of $$\sum_{n = 0}^{\infty} \frac{x^n(x - 1)^{2n}}{n!}$$ all equal $0$.

Let $S$ be a set of $9$ lattice points (points with integer coordinates) in $3$-dimensional Euclidean space. Prove that there exists a lattice point along the interior of some line segment that joins two distinct points in $S$.
Find all functions $F : \mathbb{R} \setminus \{0, 1\} \to \mathbb{R}$ that satisfy $F(x) + F\left(\frac{x - 1}{x}\right) = 1 + x$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R} \setminus \{0, 1\}$.
informal_solution: The only such function is $F(x) = \frac{x^3 - x^2 - 1}{2x(x - 1)}$.

informal_statement: Prove that, for all $a > 0$ and $b > 0$, the power series of $e^{ax} \cos (bx)$ with respect to $x$ has either zero or infinitely many zero coefficients.
Find the length of the longest possible sequence of equal nonzero digits (in base 10) in which a perfect square can terminate. Also, find the smallest square that attains this length.
informal_solution: The maximum attainable length is $3$; the smallest such square is $38^2 = 1444$.

informal_statement:
Let $A$ be a $3 \times 2$ matrix and $B$ be a $2 \times 3$ matrix such that $$AB = 
\begin{pmatrix}
8 & 2 & -2 \\
2 & 5 & 4 \\
-2 & 4 & 5
\end{pmatrix}.
$$ Prove that $$BA = 
\begin{pmatrix}
9 & 0 \\
0 & 9
\end{pmatrix}.$$
